exercises.title: Basic arithmetic
exercises.content: Ask the user for two numbers. Then, print the result of addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division of those two numbers.
exercises.solution:
a = float(input("Enter first number: "))
b = float(input("Enter second number: "))
print(f"Addition: {a + b}")
print(f"Subtraction: {a - b}")
print(f"Multiplication: {a * b}")
print(f"Division: {a / b}")

exercises.title: Format time
exercises.content: Ask the user how many total seconds a video is. Then, print how many full minutes and remaining seconds it has. Format it as "2 minutes and 35 seconds".
exercises.solution:
total_seconds = int(input("Enter total seconds: "))
minutes = total_seconds // 60
seconds = total_seconds % 60
print(f"{minutes} minutes and {seconds} seconds")

exercises.title: Area of a circle
exercises.content: Ask the user for a circle's radius, then calculate the area. Use the formula: area = π × r². Use 3.14 for π.

exercises.title: Left-to-right calculations
exercises.content:
Ask the user for integers a, b, c, and d. Then, output the result of the operation a + b ** c / d such that the order of operations is ignored (a + b first).

For example, it should output 16 rather than 8 when a = 3, b = 4, c = 2, d = 4
exercises.solution:
a = int(input("Enter a: "))
b = int(input("Enter b: "))
c = int(input("Enter c: "))
d = int(input("Enter d: "))

print((a + b) ** c / d)

questions.question: Complete the code to divide a group evenly
questions.text:
total = <@>int<@>(input("Total people: "))
groups = <@>int<@>(input("Groups: "))
people_per_group = total <@>//<@> groups
remaining_people = total <@>%<@> groups
print(f"{<@>remaining_people<@>} groups of {<@>people_per_group<@> + 1} and {groups <@>-<@> remaining_people} groups of {<@>people_per_group<@>}")
